Package frc.drive

Class DriveManager

java.lang.Object
frc.drive.DriveManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
ISubsystem
public class DriveManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements ISubsystem
Everything that has to do with driving is in here. There are a lot of auxilairy helpers and RobotSettings that feed in here.
See Also:
RobotTelemetry

    • init

      public void init() throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException, InitializationFailureException
      Initializes the driver
      Specified by:
      init in interface ISubsystem
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - When IDs for follower motors are too few or too many
      InitializationFailureException - When something fails to init properly
      See Also:
      Robot.robotInit()

    • createDriveMotors

      private void createDriveMotors() throws InitializationFailureException, java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Creates the drive motors
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - When IDs for follower motors are too few or too many
      InitializationFailureException - When follower drive motors fail to link to leaders or when leader drivetrain motors fail to invert

      Throws:

    • updateTeleop

      public void updateTeleop() throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      This is where driving happens. Call this every tick to drive and set RobotSettings.DRIVE_STYLE to change the drive stype
      Specified by:
      updateTeleop in interface ISubsystem
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if RobotSettings.DRIVE_STYLE is not implemented here or if you missed a break statement
      See Also:
      Robot.teleopPeriodic()

      public java.lang.String getSubsystemName()
      Description copied from interface: ISubsystem

    • driveFPS

      public void driveFPS​(double leftFPS, double rightFPS)
      Drives the bot based on the requested left and right speed
      Parameters:
      leftFPS - Left drivetrain speed in feet per second
      rightFPS - Right drivetrain speed in feet per second

    • drive

      public void drive​(double forward, double rotation)
      drives the robot based on -1 / 1 inputs (ie 100% forward and 100% turning)
      Parameters:
      forward - the percentage of max forward to do
      rotation - the percentage of max turn speed to do

    • setBrake

      public void setBrake​(boolean braking)

    • drivePure

      public void drivePure​(double FPS, double omega)
      This takes a speed in feet per second, a requested turn speed in radians/sec
      Parameters:
      FPS - Speed in Feet per Second
      omega - Rotation in Radians per Second

    • adjustedDrive

      private static double adjustedDrive​(double input)
      Takes a -1 to 1 scaled value and returns it scaled based on the max sped
      Parameters:
      input - -1 to 1 drive amount
      Returns:
      input scaled based on the bot's max speed

    • adjustedRotation

      private static double adjustedRotation​(double input)

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      input scaled based on max turning

    • driveMPS

      public void driveMPS​(double leftMPS, double rightMPS)
      Drives the bot based on the requested left and right speed
      Parameters:
      leftMPS - Left drivetrain speed in meters per second
      rightMPS - Right drivetrain speed in meters per second
